name: Nitryl fluoride
desc: Nitryl fluoride, NO2F, is a colourless gas and strong oxidizing agent, which is used as a fluorinating agent and has been proposed as an oxidiser in rocket propellants (though never flown). It is a molecular species, not ionic, consistent with its low boiling point. The structure features planar nitrogen with a short N-F bond length of 135 pm.
Chemical formula: NO2F
standard state:
Except where otherwise noted, data are given for materials in their standard state (at 25 °C [77 °F], 100 kPa).
